sentences.en: Deciduous trees shed their leaves in autumn.

sentences.en: European anemone with solitary white flowers common in deciduous woodlands.

sentences.en: Fusions were common between strains from deciduous hosts or coniferous hosts.
sentences.cn: 来自阔叶树或针叶树寄生的菌系间融合是普遍的.

sentences.en: Overgrown deciduous shrubs can be cut back at this time of year.
sentences.cn: 过于繁茂的落叶灌木可以在每年的这个时候修剪.

sentences.en: Regional ecosystem types, such as grass land, desert, and deciduous forest, are called biomes.
sentences.cn: 地区的生态系统, 例如草原 、 荒漠和落叶林又被称为生物带.

sentences.en: Rose, a red rose for the deciduous shrub rose family.

sentences.en: That parting of the moment, like the pathos of deciduous trees kissed.
sentences.cn: 那别离的瞬间, 似落叶吻别树枝的凄美.

sentences.en: There were 34 succession species, 9 deminant, mostly deciduous broad - leaf species.
sentences.cn: 更新树种共计34种, 占优势的仅9种, 且多为落叶阔叶树种.

sentences.en: These Texas maples are far enough south that they peak much later than many other deciduous trees in the United States.
sentences.cn: 这些德克萨斯州枫树是在足够远的南部，它们的憔悴期迟于美国的许多其他地方的落叶乔木。

sentences.en: Young permanent tooth and deciduous tooth which have high pulp horn.
sentences.cn: 青少年的恒牙和儿童的乳牙,因其髓角位置高不宜作嵌体,以免损伤牙髓.

words.tran_cn: [植]落叶性的，脱落性的；非永久性的
